name: Fairmont Vancouver Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my fourth stay at the Fairmont. The hotel is very convenient, right above the U.S. departures area. I usually stay at the hotel if I have to catch an early flight. The room, service, room service food and cleanliness were all impeccable.
reviews.title: Tranquility above the chaos

reviews.text: Many travelers flying in and out of Vancouver are often connecting to Asian destinations or arriving from overseas. It's no secret that these flights can be grueling and a night at the Fairmont can really leave you rejuvinated from a long trip or provide a relaxing environment prior to your next adventure. I would normally never recommend an airport hotel for romance but I would highly suggest a weekend getaway here for those living in the Vancouver area. The hotel is just that good and to top it off, the Fairmont is directly inside the airport. Everything is of the highest standard and I was quite simply blown away by the hotel's attention to detail. To top things off, the bathtub in my room opened up towards the bedroom, which was definately a nice touch. I could go on and on about the threatd count of the sheets and wonderful service, but I will briefly say that everyone should book a night at the Fairmont Vancouver Airport because it will definately be one of those rare experiences where you feel a hotel has done everything right. This is the standard to which all airport hotels should aspire.
reviews.title: Heaven for a night

likes.liked: — Service, attention to detail, furnishings, bathroom, location, everything else

reviews.text: After a long and tiring flight from Australia we were dismayed to find the international lounge at Vancouver airport under renovation. With a lengthy layover between flights we were delighted to find out the Fairmont offers half day rates for weary travellers.
reviews.title: Pure joy after long flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gorgeous and comfortable rooms, exceptional service ... We couldn't be more happy with this hotel. The much needed rest and relaxation was definitely worth the price.
reviews.title: quiet and handy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very quiet, comfy beds and dark curtains made for a great nights sleep. We loved the cookies in the room upon arrival. Large luxurious bathroom.
reviews.title: A True Pleasure

likes.liked: — Service Serrvice Service and fantastic rooms

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel once again! This is such a fabulous hotel. Beautiful rooms, Massive bath, Amazing shower.... need I go on?
reviews.title: Great hotel and the people aren't that bad either!

reviews.text: In response to the last review I have always found the canadian immigration dept to be really nice and very polite. With respect, these guys are pussy cats compared to the U.S immigration which is mostly the reason I get to stay at Vancouver airport, CANADA.
reviews.title: Plane Watching at the Fairmont
Plan extra time for this hotel
reviews.text: The Fairmont Vancouver is not an airport hotel, but rather a luxury hotel that happens to be at the airport. Connected to the International Terminal (near US departures check-in), the Fairmont combines luxury accomadations with a fantastic location. The rooms are completely soundproof, which is good since many rooms overlook the US departures area. If you like plane spotting, get a room on the 12th or 13th floor facing the airport -- floor to ceiling windows and binoculars included! And the Fairmont beds are among the most comfortable I've experienced.

reviews.title: pretty nice executive hotel
reviews.text: The staff is very pleasant and helpful, which is much appreciated as the YVR customs and immigration personnel tend to be a bit rude and self-important.
All in all, a great hotel in a great city. If they could only do something about the immigration officers . . . .
reviews.title: My all time favorite place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont in September of 2006, after a flight from London and a missed connection back home. The hotel is located inside the airport, just upstairs from the main terminal and check-in area. The reception lobby and reception area consists of small personalized check-in station. The staff were friendly and professional. Our room was wonderful and luxurious. The room was spacious and the king-size bed very firm. Two heavy bathrobes hung in the closet for our use. Our room overlooked the runway area but was very quiet. We never got to have breakfast because of our early flight the next day. The hotel is very convenient and luxurious, but also very expensive ($375.00 Canadian).
reviews.title: Luxury at the Airport

reviews.text: highly professional, well groomed hotel and staff, great food, beautifully appointed rooms, definately would stay again - well done
reviews.title: excellence!

reviews.text: Excellent hotel, actually stayed here for a night in August after travelling from the UK, then catching a flight to Alaska next day, and again on the way back. Rooms were huge, amazing views, very quiet, very helpful staff, check in/out very quick.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.text: Breakfasts excellent, had buffet, and lots of it!. Also had dinner one night, which was superb. Staff very good with children, very good children's menu breakfast and dinner. Equally if families wanted a cheaper meal they could nip out into the airport itself. Happy to look after our luggage in secure area whilst we spent our last day in Vancouver.
reviews.title: Absolutely the Best

likes.disliked: — The Front Desk Staff. Learn some manners!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got good price for a room on hotels on website, and paid extra for a deluxe room, to ensure a great view. Only gripe, were the bathroom doors, which were louvered and not lockable. Eldest child had to be "guarded" from youngest (and naughtiest) child!
reviews.title: Very Luxurious

likes.disliked: — Because it was in the airport, it is not convenient to any attractions/restaurants

reviews.text: This was the perfect way to end a two week vacation! Flew in from Alaska with plans to fly to Atlanta the next morning. Hotel is in airport, check in took two minutes. Restaurant was exceptonal, great food and service. Fairmont has sound proofing down to an art-I could see the planes, but couldn't hear them. The stay was so relaxing, we stayed two more days and flew to Victoria and returned to the Fairmont for the last evening. Best of all, I found a non refundable internet special rate of $199 US on the Fairmont web site.
reviews.title: Great luxury and service

reviews.text: This is another North American standard 5-star hotel with decent large and sound-proofed rooms. Our problem was with the service. Generally it was slow; check-in and check-out took longer than necessary; we had to wait at least 15 minutes each way.
reviews.title: Incomplete and slow service
Fantastic Airport Hotel
reviews.text: A major problem I had was upon arriving at the hotel in the rental car. Some guy in an airport uniform told me I had to move the car away within 15 minutes. As the porter hadn't even greeted me yet, I had no idea how long it would be until I could move out of there. My next request could be classified as unusual. I asked the hotel staff to arrange dropping off the car to the airport rental place for me or, failing that, arrange for the rental place to come and pick it up. I had been driving for a few long days, it was late, I was in no mood to get behind the wheel again, and this was a 5-star hotel. It turns out this couldn't be done; it was if I was asking for a ride to outer space. Surely at an airport hotel, this wouldn't have been the first request for this, especially given this 15 minute parking restriction. An unusual request, but hotels of this class are supposed to deal with unusual requests. All over Europe and Asia, I show up at the front entrance of a 5-star hotel, and I don't have to think about the car again; they deal with it for me. Not at the Fairmont!

Airport hotels are usually a necessary evil but the Fairmont Vancouver Airport is an exception to that and with perhaps the exception of only the Kempinski Hotel at the Munich Airport, this is by far the best airport hotel I have ever stayed at. The hotel is located directly in the terminal and is adjancent to the US Departures area making it very convenient for those with morning depatures to the states--the hotel is only a 5 minutes walk to the other international depatures and the walk is entirely within the terminal. Check-in was a breeze and we were give a Signature Room on the 9th floor. The room is huge and has an incredibly large bathroom with jetted tub, separate shower and all the other acoutrements of 5* hotel bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the desk was very comfortable. The TV was a bit small for a room this big but nothing too problematic. We had a view "airside" so we could watch the planes at the gates and some of the landings. The other side of the hotel has views of the runway and, given the number of international departures, I imagine a great spot for planespotting. The restaurant was very good both for dinner and breakfast and the few staff we came into contact with were great. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone arrviing late in the evening or with a morning depature as it is a true 5* airport hotel. One word of caution about YVR: If you are travelling back to the States, try and determine if any cruise ships have just returned. Three or four cruise ships had arrived early on the morning of our depature and the lines to check-in, clear immigaration/customs and security were very long as it took us about 2 1/2 hour to complete the entire process!
reviews.title: Superb start to a bad holiday

reviews.text: We stayed at the Fairmont Vancouver AIrport on the first day of our holiday, prior to picking up an RV on the second day..... less said about the RV/Van the better
reviews.title: Still a great choice for stopping over

description: The Fairmont Vancouver Airport hotel is the only soundproofed, luxury hotel and spa conveniently located within Vancouver's International Airport (YVR). Situated directly above the US departures terminal only a two-minute stroll from the luggage carousels. Sleep in luxury right above your gate and avoid shuttles. This AAA / CAA 4-diamond airport hotel features:- an extensive Health Club and Spa- soundproofed guestrooms- breathtaking floor-to-ceiling views- day use roomsThe Fairmont Vancouver Airport hotel's award-winning, signature restaurant, GlobeYVR Restaurant is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner seven days a week.Wireless Internet Access is available in all of our guest rooms and is complimentary for Fairmont President's Club members, free to join.
